#summary How to run X11 apps over SSH connections

= Introduction =

This document explains how to log into a UNIX system (Debian, in the examples) and run X11 applications.

= Server =

You need basic X11 infrastructure and the package _xauth_ installed:

{{{
$ sudo apt-get install x11-common x11-apps xauth
}}}

X11 forwarding must be enabled (restard ssh daemon if needed):

{{{
# /etc/ssh/sshd_config
X11Forwarding yes
...

$ sudo /etc/init.d/ssh restart
}}}

= Client =

Use the _-X_ option when loggin in with ssh:

{{{
$ ssh -X user@host
...

$ echo $DISPLAY
localhost:10.0

$ xcalc
}}}

If you enable X11 forwarding in the configuration you can omit _-X_:

{{{
# /etc/ssh/ssh_config
ForwardX11 yes
}}}
